text: Jan Boyer Wahl (April 1, 1931 - January 29, 2019) was an American children's author. He was born in Columbus, Ohio. He was an author of over 120 works, and was known primarily for his award-winning children's books, including Pleasant Fieldmouse, The Furious Flycycle, and Humphrey's Bear. Wahl died on January 29, 2019 in Toledo, Ohio from prostate cancer, aged 87.Jan Wahl, Children's Writer Who Attracted Top Artists, Dies at 87 ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Ohio Category:American children's writers Category:Writers from Columbus, Ohio
title: Jan Wahl
